name: Trinity Capital Hotel

reviews.title: Pretty reasonable
reviews.text: Good room size and great location. Reception not ideal but it does have bar. Would recommend it if you will only be using it as a base.

reviews.title: Terrible Experience
reviews.text: My family and I had a total of four rooms the 3rd and 4th of July. It was very warm and there was no air conditioning. We opened the window and left it open all day and night, but it was unbearably hot at night even with just a sheet on the bed. The worst part of the whole experience was the noise all night long!! Trinity Capital Hotel is right over the top of a huge fire station that is busy all night. Because we had the window open it was impossible to sleep due to the noise. I am not sure that it would have been better to have a room on the other side of the hotel due to the traffic noise.

We were not happy with the cleanliness of our rooms. The bedspread on our bed was so soiled (blood and dirt) that we took it off the bed. The bed and pillows were not comfortable and there was a strong smoke smell in our room. We had asked for a non-smoking room and didn't get it. We tried first thing in the morning to switch to a non-smoking room and were told to pack our things and by the time we got back to the room after sight-seeing we would be switched to our new room by the staff. When we returned we were told that because we had not packed our belongings the did not move us. They had made an error with the room numbers and got our room mixed up with my daughters!! And, of course at that point there were now no rooms available. Because we had left our keys in the room when we packed up they gave us a new key which didn't open the door. On the way back down to the desk I tried it in my daughters door and it opened that room. They still had the two rooms mixed up! I was very unimpressed with the management and staff.
reviews.title: Is this the noisiest hotel in Dublin? Yes!
Trinity Capital offers great location!
reviews.text: The food was ok, but very expensive since we did not include that in our cost when booking. It cost 50 Euro for two for breakfast!
The only good thing that I can say about this hotel is the location as far as being central to sight seeing.But, all in all a very bad experience.
reviews.title: The Best Value in Dublin
Ok for the money
reviews.text: Spent the weekend here (2 nights) in mid June.
Hi, I spent three nights in this hotel from July 13th to July 16th. I booked this hotel after reading nice comments in this web site.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and staff but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can say it was a nice experience. It's true it has the best location. Rooms were clean. Staff really friendly. It was the fastest check in I ever had. I mean, it was like if they were actually waiting for me to arrive. I tried the room service for dinner. No extra charges. Staff again really nice. I do not really understand previous comments in this regard. Food good. My advise: if you want a non-smoking room, e-mail them. That´s what I did. Only one complaint: my room was close to the fire station. It's noisy but I could sleep. Breakfast was really good.
reviews.title: Well worth getting the mini suite

reviews.text: Having had a big nosy around this hotel, we feel that it is well worth the money to 'splash' out on a mini suite room as you get so much more for your room. The beds are just huge and the jacuzzi bath is such fun! Breakfast was very good with a full cooked and cereal, toast ,crossiants (well adviced), although really do advise you get in there fairly early as it does fill up. The location is superb, really close to everything you need and a stones throw away from Triinty college. We enjoyed our stay here, despite the sometimes rather interesting idea of service (oh no not you! The greeting from staff when delivering room service).
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Great hotel and staff! all were very nice and helpfull!
reviews.title: hot, hot, hot...

description: The Trinity Capital Hotel is a uniquely stylish boutique property located in the heart of Dublin City Centre, opposite Trinity College. Each of our 195 guestrooms offers everything that you would expect including WIFI internet access, welcome trays, laptop size safe & interactive TVs. Guests can avail of stylish upgrades and can choose between 8 Georgian Suites and 4 Mini-Suites. Cafe Cairo, the hotels bar and restaurant, offers an extensive menu sure to satisfy any palate.
